pr_title: Update Form Recognizer Readme and samples

timeline.message: Form Training async client test part 1
Remove generic fieldvalue instead use generic FormField

timeline.bodyText: if possible we can remove this unchecked?
timeline.author: mssfang
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -108,10 +108,9 @@ public static USReceipt asUSReceipt(RecognizedReceipt receipt) {
     @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")

replies.bodyText:
We cannot, using generics and this will throw error warnings when building the client.
It is a common pattern to suppress when using generics.
replies.author: samvaity

timeline.bodyText: is possible to just use .subscribe() instead of .last()?
timeline.author: mssfang

replies.bodyText: .last() definitely gives better control over the code flow to not continue until a response is received.
replies.author: samvaity

timeline.bodyText: I think it'd be best to have the forms also in the samples folder, doesn't look great going into the test folder
timeline.author: iscai-msft

timeline.bodyText: I think the name of this file is different than what you referenced it as in the samples readme
timeline.author: iscai-msft

@@ -0,0 +1,74 @@

timeline.bodyText: Differences between labeled and unlabeled might be more clear without decomposition. For example, I didn't print label data information for the labeled custom model, while I did for unlabeled
timeline.author: iscai-msft

timeline.bodyText: Also not the same name as the samples readme
timeline.author: iscai-msft
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,94 @@
+// Copyright (c) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.

timeline.bodyText: I think we determined we were going to use recognize custom forms from file for the manual validation sample
timeline.author: iscai-msft

timeline.bodyText: I think it'd be good to include the index of the form you're recognizing in this print statement, in case there are multiple returned forms
timeline.author: iscai-msft

timeline.bodyText: I think it'd be better to just print the model ids of the models you're listing, and then call getCustomModel with a single model id and print out more of that information. That way there's less information being printed and you can highlight lisModels and getCustomModel separately
timeline.author: iscai-msft

timeline.bodyText: It might be nice to include a get of that model after deletion. this way you can show what error is thrown when accessing a custom model that doesn't exist, and how to check that the model is deleted.
timeline.author: iscai-msft

timeline.bodyText: I thought java had automatic content type detection. If so, can you not pass the content type since that's what most users will be doing
timeline.author: iscai-msft

replies.bodyText: Considering the samples might get in before the feature would like to keep it this way and maybe consider updating once we get the feature in.
replies.author: samvaity

timeline.bodyText: Confused why this file is empty
timeline.author: iscai-msft

timeline.bodyText: I know we said Java might diverge on this (doing file for sync, url for async), but I think that because you've added a recognizeReceipts and a recognizeReceipts FromURL, you can have the other sync and async functions call the files functions
timeline.author: iscai-msft

timeline.bodyText: I think you should link to the recognizeCustomForms sample.
timeline.author: iscai-msft

timeline.bodyText: I think you want to link to the labeled and unlabeled custom model training samples
timeline.author: iscai-msft

timeline.bodyText: In python this is called listModelInfos, are we ok with the languages diverging here?
timeline.author: iscai-msft

replies.bodyText: Updated this to be in sync with .NET at the moment. Also, on the basis on #8299 (comment)
